title: Cruise line to pay penalties, damages over disability violations
text:
Cruise line to pay penalties, damages over disability violations Adv: 
Jul 23, 2015 Adv: 
WASHINGTON, DC - "Carnival cruise vacation is perfect for guests with disabilities. Fun for all, all for fun!" On Thursday US Justice Department made sure that this advertising pitch is indeed true. 
The Florida-based cruise line was fined $55,000 and ordered to pay $350,000 in damages, the Justice Department said on Thursday. 
Although, while not admitting any wrongdoing, Carnival Corp has agreed to pay the penalties over alleged accessibility violations for people with disabilities on its cruise ships. The cruise line also agreed to make improvements in accessibility on all ships across its Carnival Cruise Line, Holland America Line and Princess Cruises brands, to make sure passengers with disabilities have equal access to cabins.
